major_contraindications: Angioedema history with ACE inhibitors,Pregnancy,Bilateral renal artery stenosis
major_drug_interactions: Potassium supplements/potassium-sparing diuretics (hyperkalemia),NSAIDs (reduced antihypertensive effect),Lithium (increased lithium levels)
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: Common first-line antihypertensive in Nigeria. Risk of dry cough and angioedema.

major_contraindications: Angioedema with ACE inhibitors,Pregnancy,Bilateral renal artery stenosis
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: Long-acting ACE inhibitor. Once-daily dosing. Popular in Nigeria.

major_contraindications: Angioedema with ACE inhibitors,Pregnancy,Bilateral renal artery stenosis
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: Once-daily ACE inhibitor. Good for cardiovascular protection.

major_contraindications: Angioedema with ACE inhibitors,Pregnancy,Bilateral renal artery stenosis
food_interactions: Take before breakfast
notes: Long-acting ACE inhibitor with good cardiovascular outcomes data.

major_contraindications: Pregnancy,Bilateral renal artery stenosis
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: Alternative to ACE inhibitors without cough. Common in Nigeria.

major_contraindications: Pregnancy,Bilateral renal artery stenosis,Biliary obstruction
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: Long-acting ARB with metabolic benefits. Once-daily dosing.

major_contraindications: Pregnancy,Bilateral renal artery stenosis
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: ARB with good evidence for heart failure and post-MI.

major_contraindications: Pregnancy,Bilateral renal artery stenosis
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: ARB with good renoprotective effects in diabetes.

major_contraindications: Severe bradycardia,Heart block (2nd/3rd degree),Uncontrolled heart failure,Asthma
food_interactions: Take with or without food, avoid abrupt discontinuation
notes: Cardioselective beta-blocker. Common and cheap in Nigeria. Renal dosing required.

major_contraindications: Severe bradycardia,Heart block,Uncontrolled heart failure,Asthma
food_interactions: Take with or at end of meals
notes: Cardioselective beta-blocker. Good for hypertension and heart failure.

major_contraindications: Severe bradycardia,Heart block,Uncontrolled heart failure,Asthma
food_interactions: Take in morning with or without food
notes: Highly cardioselective. Once-daily dosing. Good for heart failure.

mechanism_of_action: Blocks beta-1 and beta-2 adrenergic receptors
major_contraindications: Asthma (absolute contraindication),Severe bradycardia,Heart block,Uncontrolled heart failure
food_interactions: Take with food, avoid abrupt discontinuation
notes: Non-selective beta-blocker. Used for hypertension anxiety migraine. Avoid in asthma.

mechanism_of_action: Blocks alpha-1 beta-1 and beta-2 receptors
major_contraindications: Severe bradycardia,Heart block,Decompensated heart failure,Asthma,Severe hepatic impairment
food_interactions: Take with food to slow absorption and reduce orthostatic hypotension
notes: Alpha and beta blocker. Good for heart failure. Take with food.

mechanism_of_action: Blocks alpha-1 beta-1 and beta-2 receptors
major_contraindications: Severe bradycardia,Heart block,Asthma,Severe hepatic impairment
food_interactions: Take with food
notes: Useful for hypertensive emergencies and pregnancy hypertension. IV and oral available.

mechanism_of_action: Blocks L-type calcium channels in vascular smooth muscle
major_contraindications: Severe aortic stenosis,Hypotension
major_drug_interactions: Simvastatin (increased simvastatin levels),CYP3A4 inhibitors (increased amlodipine levels),Grapefruit juice (increased levels)
food_interactions: Avoid grapefruit juice
notes: Very popular in Nigeria. Long-acting. Once-daily. Ankle swelling common.

mechanism_of_action: Blocks L-type calcium channels in vascular smooth muscle
major_contraindications: Severe aortic stenosis,Cardiogenic shock,Acute MI
major_drug_interactions: Beta-blockers (if combined cautiously),Grapefruit juice (increased levels),CYP3A4 inhibitors (increased nifedipine levels)
food_interactions: Avoid grapefruit juice, take extended-release on empty stomach
notes: Short-acting form used for hypertensive urgency. Extended-release for maintenance.

mechanism_of_action: Blocks L-type calcium channels in vascular smooth muscle
major_contraindications: Severe aortic stenosis,Hypotension
major_drug_interactions: CYP3A4 inhibitors (increased levels),Grapefruit juice (significantly increased levels),Beta-blockers (enhanced antihypertensive effect)
food_interactions: Avoid grapefruit juice completely, take in morning
notes: Long-acting dihydropyridine. Very sensitive to grapefruit interaction.

mechanism_of_action: Blocks L-type calcium channels in heart and vascular smooth muscle
major_contraindications: Heart block (2nd/3rd degree),Severe bradycardia,Hypotension,Concurrent IV beta-blockers,Atrial flutter/fibrillation with accessory pathway
major_drug_interactions: Beta-blockers (severe bradycardia/heart block),Digoxin (increased digoxin levels),Simvastatin (increased statin levels),CYP3A4 inhibitors (increased verapamil levels)
food_interactions: Avoid grapefruit juice, take with food
notes: Non-dihydropyridine CCB. Rate-controlling. Constipation common. Avoid with beta-blockers.

mechanism_of_action: Blocks L-type calcium channels in heart and vascular smooth muscle
major_contraindications: Heart block (2nd/3rd degree),Severe bradycardia,Hypotension,Concurrent IV beta-blockers
major_drug_interactions: Beta-blockers (bradycardia),Digoxin (increased digoxin levels),Statins (increased statin levels),CYP3A4 inhibitors (increased diltiazem levels)
food_interactions: Take before meals
notes: Non-dihydropyridine CCB for rate control and hypertension. Less constipation than verapamil.

mechanism_of_action: Inhibits sodium reabsorption in distal tubule
major_contraindications: Anuria,Sulfonamide allergy
major_drug_interactions: Lithium (increased lithium levels),Digoxin (hypokalemia increases digoxin toxicity),NSAIDs (reduced diuretic effect),Corticosteroids (hypokalemia)
food_interactions: Take in morning to avoid nocturia, with or without food
notes: Very common first-line diuretic in Nigeria. Monitor potassium. Take in morning.

mechanism_of_action: Inhibits Na-K-2Cl cotransporter in loop of Henle
major_contraindications: Anuria,Severe electrolyte depletion,Hepatic coma
major_drug_interactions: Aminoglycosides (increased ototoxicity),Lithium (increased levels),Digoxin (hypokalemia increases toxicity),NSAIDs (reduced effect)
food_interactions: Take in morning, with or without food, increase fluid intake
notes: Most commonly used diuretic in Nigerian hospitals. Potent. Monitor electrolytes closely.

mechanism_of_action: Inhibits Na-K-2Cl cotransporter in loop of Henle
major_contraindications: Anuria,Severe electrolyte depletion,Hepatic coma
food_interactions: Take in morning
notes: 40x more potent than furosemide. Used when furosemide resistance.

major_contraindications: Hyperkalemia,Severe renal impairment,Addison's disease,Concurrent potassium supplements
major_drug_interactions: ACE inhibitors/ARBs (severe hyperkalemia),Potassium supplements (severe hyperkalemia),NSAIDs (reduced effect),Digoxin (increased digoxin levels)
food_interactions: Take with food, monitor potassium closely
notes: Potassium-sparing diuretic. Essential in heart failure. Risk of hyperkalemia. Gynecomastia in men.

mechanism_of_action: Blocks epithelial sodium channels in collecting duct
major_contraindications: Hyperkalemia,Severe renal impairment,Anuria
food_interactions: Take with food, monitor potassium
notes: Potassium-sparing diuretic. Often combined with hydrochlorothiazide.

mechanism_of_action: Inhibits sodium reabsorption in distal tubule
major_contraindications: Anuria,Sulfonamide allergy
food_interactions: Take in morning
notes: Longer-acting than HCTZ. Preferred by some guidelines. Monitor potassium.

major_contraindications: Anuria,Severe renal impairment,Hepatic encephalopathy
food_interactions: Take in morning with or without food
notes: Thiazide-like with vasodilating properties. Less metabolic side effects.

major_contraindications: Active bleeding,Hemophilia,Severe thrombocytopenia,Peptic ulcer disease,Children under 12 with viral infections (Reye's syndrome risk)
major_drug_interactions: Warfarin (increased bleeding),Other anticoagulants (bleeding),NSAIDs (increased GI bleeding),Methotrexate (increased toxicity)
food_interactions: Take with food to reduce GI upset
notes: Essential for cardiovascular protection. Low dose (75-150mg) for prevention. GI protection may be needed.

major_contraindications: Active pathological bleeding,Severe hepatic impairment,Concurrent use of CYP2C19 inhibitors (reduces activation)
black_box_warning_text: Increased risk of bleeding. Discontinue 5-7 days before elective surgery. Reduced efficacy in CYP2C19 poor metabolizers (common in some populations).
major_drug_interactions: Warfarin (increased bleeding),NSAIDs (increased GI bleeding),PPIs (may reduce clopidogrel effectiveness)
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: Essential after stent placement. Genetic variations affect efficacy. PPIs may reduce effectiveness.

mechanism_of_action: Reversibly blocks ADP receptor on platelets
major_contraindications: Active bleeding,History of intracranial hemorrhage,Severe hepatic impairment
black_box_warning_text: Increased risk of bleeding. More potent than clopidogrel. Reversible binding. Dyspnea common side effect (10-15%).
major_drug_interactions: Warfarin (increased bleeding),Aspirin >100mg (increased bleeding),Strong CYP3A4 inhibitors (avoid),Digoxin (increased digoxin levels)
food_interactions: Take with or without food, twice daily
notes: More potent than clopidogrel. No genetic variability. Dyspnea common. Expensive.

mechanism_of_action: Irreversibly blocks ADP receptor on platelets
major_contraindications: Active bleeding,History of TIA/stroke,Age ≥75 years (relative),Weight <60 kg (relative)
black_box_warning_text: Increased bleeding risk especially in elderly (≥75) and low weight (<60 kg). More potent than clopidogrel.
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: More potent than clopidogrel. Higher bleeding risk. Avoid in elderly >75 and low weight.

monitoring_type: Lipid panel, Liver function, Muscle pain
major_contraindications: Active liver disease,Pregnancy,Breastfeeding,Concurrent strong CYP3A4 inhibitors with high statin doses
major_drug_interactions: Fibrates (myopathy risk),Niacin (myopathy),Cyclosporine (increased statin levels),Grapefruit juice (increased levels),CYP3A4 inhibitors (increased levels)
food_interactions: Avoid large amounts of grapefruit juice, take any time of day
notes: Most commonly prescribed statin. Long half-life. Take any time. Monitor liver and muscle.

monitoring_type: Lipid panel, Liver function, Muscle pain
major_contraindications: Active liver disease,Pregnancy,Breastfeeding,Concurrent potent CYP3A4 inhibitors
major_drug_interactions: Fibrates (myopathy),CYP3A4 inhibitors (increased simvastatin levels),Grapefruit juice (significantly increased levels),Amiodarone (dose limit 20mg)
food_interactions: Avoid grapefruit juice, take in evening
notes: Many drug interactions. Limit 20mg with amiodarone. Take evening. Avoid grapefruit.

monitoring_type: Lipid panel, Liver function, Muscle pain
major_contraindications: Active liver disease,Pregnancy,Breastfeeding,Concurrent cyclosporine
food_interactions: Take any time of day, with or without food
notes: Most potent statin. Fewer drug interactions than simvastatin. More expensive.

monitoring_type: Lipid panel, Liver function, Muscle pain
major_contraindications: Active liver disease,Pregnancy,Breastfeeding
food_interactions: Take any time, with or without food
notes: Hydrophilic statin. Fewer drug interactions. Less potent than atorvastatin.

monitoring_type: Lipid panel, Liver function, Muscle pain
major_contraindications: Active liver disease,Pregnancy,Breastfeeding
food_interactions: Take in evening, with or without food
notes: Least potent statin. Fewer drug interactions. Used when others not tolerated.

monitoring_type: Lipid panel, Liver function, Renal function
major_contraindications: Severe renal impairment,Severe hepatic impairment,Gallbladder disease,Breastfeeding
food_interactions: Take with food
notes: Good for high triglycerides. Monitor renal function. Increases warfarin effect significantly.

major_contraindications: Severe renal impairment,Severe hepatic impairment,Gallbladder disease,Concurrent statin use (increased myopathy risk)
food_interactions: Take 30 minutes before morning and evening meals
notes: Avoid with statins (rhabdomyolysis risk). Increases warfarin significantly. Take before meals.

mechanism_of_action: Inhibits cholesterol absorption at intestinal brush border
major_contraindications: Active liver disease (when used with statin),Pregnancy (when used with statin)
major_drug_interactions: Fibrates (increased ezetimibe levels),Cyclosporine (increased levels of both)
food_interactions: Take with or without food
notes: Add-on to statins when statin alone insufficient. Well-tolerated. Expensive.

mechanism_of_action: Inhibits Na-K-ATPase (increases contractility and slows AV conduction)
monitoring_type: Digoxin level, Renal function, Potassium, Heart rate
major_contraindications: Ventricular fibrillation,AV block (without pacemaker),Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy,Constrictive pericarditis
major_drug_interactions: Amiodarone (increased digoxin levels),Verapamil/diltiazem (increased levels),Diuretics (hypokalemia increases toxicity),Macrolides (increased levels),Quinidine (doubled digoxin levels)
food_interactions: Take consistently same time daily, with or without food
notes: Narrow therapeutic window. Many drug interactions. Monitor levels. Toxicity common in elderly.

monitoring_type: Thyroid, Liver, Pulmonary, QT interval, Eyes
major_contraindications: Sinus bradycardia,AV block (without pacemaker),Severe sinus node dysfunction,Thyroid disorders
black_box_warning_text: Pulmonary toxicity (potentially fatal), Liver toxicity, Thyroid dysfunction (hyper/hypo), Corneal deposits, QT prolongation, Multiple drug interactions. Requires close monitoring.
food_interactions: Take with food
notes: Very effective antiarrhythmic but many serious side effects. Requires monitoring of thyroid liver lungs.

major_contraindications: Coronary artery disease,Mitral valvular rheumatic heart disease,Hypersensitivity
food_interactions: Take with food consistently
notes: Direct vasodilator. Used with beta-blocker to prevent reflex tachycardia. Lupus-like syndrome risk at high doses.

major_contraindications: Hypotension,Concurrent PDE5 inhibitors (sildenafil etc),Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy,Severe anemia
food_interactions: Take on empty stomach, avoid alcohol
notes: Nitrate for angina. Tolerance develops - needs nitrate-free interval. Headache common.

major_contraindications: Hypotension,Concurrent PDE5 inhibitors,Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
food_interactions: Take in morning on empty stomach
notes: Active metabolite of dinitrate. Once-daily dosing. Less tolerance than dinitrate.

major_contraindications: Hypotension,Concurrent PDE5 inhibitors (absolute contraindication),Severe anemia,Increased intracranial pressure
major_drug_interactions: PDE5 inhibitors (fatal hypotension - contraindicated within 24-48 hours),Alcohol (enhanced hypotension)
food_interactions: Sublingual: place under tongue, do not swallow
notes: Rapid-acting for acute angina. Sublingual or spray. Headache common. Short shelf-life.
